website_summaries.verdict: A popular model that comes with user-friendly features for a reasonable price.
pros: Affordable vacuum offers Shark's impressive suction in a classic upright design
Boasts a spacious canister that can be removed from the unit for hard-to-reach cleaning
cons: The design is a bit bulky compared to many other Shark models
It's also top-heavy, which makes it prone to tipping

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuums
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Shark. My old one had a small hole in the hose and since Shark no longer makes that model, I couldnt fix it. I got it last night, vacuumed with my old red and white. Then blue. Then vacuumed again this morning with blue. Ew. Dogs, and carpet is so gross. I do feel better knowing that Shark is really sucking up a LOT of small matter though
customer_reviews.author: ReviewReader

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work on thick carpet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this vacuum as my 3rd vacuum in 3 weeks. We got new super thick carpet and was hoping this would roll easily on the carpet. (2 Dysons prior do not like moving forward only pulling backward) As soon as the bristle head turns on and hits the thick carpet it stops and does not turn on again. It works great on thin carpet and hardwood but if you want it for anything with thickness this is NOT the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Socrules023

customer_reviews.title: ... this machine for 6 months and it really was great until the carpet brush stopped rotating
customer_reviews.text: I have had this machine for 6 months and it really was great until the carpet brush stopped rotating. The warranty is for the motor only and not anything else. Tech support was easy to reach and told me that I would have to pay for a new bottom section; $95 plus shipping. They would not guarantee this new part either. I am in the process of deciding on our next vacuum, but it will not be a Shark or anyother machine with a crappy warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton A. Francis

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself the money.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like writing negative reviews but if I can save someone else money and trouble I’m in. This may be the worst vacuum I have ever purchased. The suction is horrible and yes I have adjusted the ring. I like nice clean strokes on my carpet and this gives weird multiple stripe effects from the brush. I had to go over areas several times. I’m so disappointed. Bummer! It was easy to put together on the upside. Ugh! I wish I could post a video so you could see just how poor of a job it does.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M Hakala

customer_reviews.title: Overall good
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm happy with this vacuum. Pros and cons: Pros: Cleans really good Easy to switch the different settings for your different needs Swivels very easily Not loud Good price for a main brand good quality vacuum. Filters easy to clean. Cons: I see what other reviewers are saying about how it topples over easily when using the hose. Very annoying. Cord is not long enough. It's slowing me down having to re-plug the cord for every room. As someone who had always been used to a vacuum with a bag, seeing the dirt in the clear canister and having to dump it out is really gross.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Just like everything else I buy on amazon
customer_reviews.text: Just like everything else I buy on amazon, I read the reviews on products until I confuse myself as to what I should buy. I am glad I settled on this vacuum, best amazon purchase I've had in a while. It can detach for portability, suction like a boss, attachments that come with are great but I also bought an additional kit, it is easy to clean and it is not super bulky. You can reach any spot in the house! What more do you need? Just make sure you empty the vacuum after use and shake out the filter and this thing will treat you right!
customer_reviews.author: Jabroni

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware...
customer_reviews.text: I bought my unit and registered it October 25, 2018 and have used it about once every two weeks. I called Shark today to inform them that the brush head stopped working... I was informed that it needed a new head and the cost would be almost $100.. Not today... I'll be shopping for another brand that has a product warranty that is a warranty... Shark is a joke.. No stars if I could...
customer_reviews.author: uscreek

customer_reviews.title: Junk Junk Junk
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy for hard floors or upholstery especially if you have dogs. It clogs up with dog hair on the hard floor and the upholstery attachment about made me take it right out to the trash. It’s awkward as hell its got these rotating elbows that are supposed to be convenient but they are anything but convenient. If you try to use it with the long attachment the vacuum will just fall over. And the “pet hair” attachment sounds cool but is about as useless as my wife’s dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY IT. YOU WILL REGRET IT.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst vacuum I have ever used in the 70 years of cleaning. The machine is clumsy and falls over when trying to use the attachments. If you try to stretch the hose even a little the vacuum tips over. It is terribly heavy. The only decent thing is the ability to remove the tank to vacuum the stairs. It emptys easily. I wish I had returned it and got my money back!
customer_reviews.author: Joan Chalifoux

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE! The roll-brush attachment is NOT included!
customer_reviews.text: I'm leaving a poor review because the product is incorrectly advertised. The product images clearly show a roll-brush attachment. There is no such attachment with this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: natureboyms

customer_reviews.title: I like this vacuum - GREAT SUCTION
customer_reviews.text: I like this vacuum - GREAT SUCTION; however, there are several features that should be noted that are negative: (1) cord is way too short; (2) machine is top heavy or something because it falls over a lot; (3) hose - even after trying my best to stretch and stretch it out, still gives me fits when I am trying to reach it high on walls, ceiling lights, etc.; (4) extension rod could be longer; (5) extension for under furniture and appliances comes off too easily when vacuuming.
customer_reviews.author: ScarletRose32333

customer_reviews.title: what a huge disappointment. In the short time owning this unit it's ...
customer_reviews.text: I have owned three Sharks, this one the newest,what a huge disappointment. In the short time owning this unit it's tipped over at least 20 xs. Very flimsy, latch broke off, and the plastic is very cheap compared to last two Sharks. Very displeased with unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome vacuum! I love it!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I think I am in love! I just got my new vacuum delivered today. It's a Shark lift away deluxe. I paid $160 for it on Amazon (thank you Aunt Barbara Thropp) my other vacuum is a $500 Kirby I literally just finished vacuuming my floors when UPS showed up with this beauty. I took it out of the package put it together and vacuumed my floors again! I can't believe all the extra dirt and dog hair it picked up it's crazy. My floors even feel better under my feet!
customer_reviews.author: LeAnne Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: From a functional design perspective, the Shark Lift Away design is a disaster. The key function of a vacuum is to pick up dirt, right? This one does OK until it clogs, which it does with great regularity. The vacuum path in this thing has five sharp bends and at least one unneeded constriction, all of which are prone to clogging. It appears the designer focused on ease of mobility at the expense of the primary function. This was stupid choice; it doesn’t matter how easy it is to maneuver unless it’s picking up dirt in the process. I’d give it zero stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Has great suction on carpet.
customer_reviews.text: The Shark Navigator has great suction on carpet and like the option to detach the different parts to use in various ways. Did not like the little brush. The bristles were way too short to be able to adequately clean anything, I also felt the hose attached to the handle could have been longer and/or more flexible to reach. I also wasn't satisfied with the bare floor cleaning sufficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy L.

customer_reviews.title: This vacuum is already broken and I have only had it for a year! Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Shark I have owned. I thought that when my first one broke after 2 years it was a fluke. It does clean well. I bought this in 12/15 and it already has lost its suction. It will not even spin on the hard wood or carpet feature. This is 150$ down the drain. I am so disappointed. I am going to try a Dyson. The parts are just cheap plastic and don't last.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel S.

customer_reviews.title: Choose another vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: Wow... I'm 5'4" - short by most standards and was looking for an easily maneuverable vacuum. The wand on this is a far cry from as it's depicted - I still have to bend (6 rods in my spine make that painful). The power cord connects at near the floor and has to be constantly picked up. Even the power button is not within easy reach. Now the dust bucket... Small and does not fully empty without sticking something up there to pull out debris (I have lots of dog hair). For the price and name, I expected a decent machine. On a scale of 1 to 10, this gets a 2.
customer_reviews.author: Marcella C.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you have deep pile carpet or carpet that is brand new!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum before my new carpet was installed and when I tried to vacuum the new carpet, the suction is too strong and the vacuum doesn't move. I had to drag it across the floor. Opening the suction valve had no impact. When I spoke with a rep at Shark, they informed that the reason this vacuum won't work is because my carpet is too new. Huh? So for this vacuum to work, I have to wear down my new carpet.
customer_reviews.author: klcsea

customer_reviews.title: Most definitely 100% works on anything
customer_reviews.text: Cleans hardwood floors Tile carpet especially dirt does pet hair pet dandruff I love Shark vacuums I actually have a collection of Shark vacuums I didn't even get insurance because it always lasts a long time I recommend it if you have animals kids or even just dirt and dust it's perfect area rugs the big heavy duty rugs where you wipe your feet on easy to adjust it take it off put it back on easy compatible I have rheumatoid arthritis and I can still use it with my hands I recommend it for even older people when's the button it comes off it's easy to carry very lightweight
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Not great for carpet
customer_reviews.text: Just received today and tried in small apartment w/ 2 ppl 1 cat. Cons- VERY hard to push across carpet (medium pile, not shag), luckily we only have a 5x7 rug. Preferred the dust bin easy release on my old dirt devil, there are more locks & levers to locate on this model. Power brush tool has short bristles, didn't seem quite as powerful. Not well balanced, fell over several times. Pros- compact enough to fit in small closet, allergy seal, versatility. Doesn't seem to leak dust, has multiple filters for catching all allergens. Powerful suction. For the moment, satisfied but not thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Scubasteve

customer_reviews.title: Great suction, short cord
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved the suction of Shark products and this one definitely does not disappoint in that regard. The one thing I wish it had was a longer cord. Even in my smaller home, I have to constantly unplug and re-plug as I move around my larger living room or from one room to the next. I previously had a different Shark model that had a really long cord so I didn't even think to check that before buying this one. It's a minor inconvenience. The unit comes apart easily for vacuuming the stairs without lugging the entire machine and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hide small children and pets
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gawd. This thing SUCKS. In a good way. I was pleasantly horrified but how much dog hair and dirt this vacuumed up. I had to empty it 3 times while I vacuumed my whole house. Of course it’s been a few weeks since my house was cleaned, but still. The suction power is incredible but the unit is a little awkward to use in my opinion. I think I’ll get used to it but I definitely felt like I was getting a core work out finagling it around the house. It’s loud, it’s awkward but is sucks like a champ. Don’t get it near anything small, it’ll suck it up.
customer_reviews.author: wendy g

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Ok so this was my first shark, I’ve been a bissle owner my whole life. So I was expecting to be amazed by this. And let me tell you I was disappointed. This vacuum is so cheap feeling the plastic chips if it touches anything! There’s no place for half the attachments. And it’s kind of heavy to push. Now I will say the suction is pretty good. But I’ve only had it for a couple weeks so we’ll see how that goes. You have to keep up with changing the filters on it too. But honestly I wish I could have my cord rewind bissle back! 😔 way too much money for what I got!!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Shark vacuum and I really like this brand! My first Shark is still working (it's approx. 7 years old), but I really wanted an upgrade. I wanted the lift away feature. I love it! These vacuums are built to last! The suction is great, yet it's NOT so strong it that it will tear fibers. There is a release suction swith on the wand should a curtain or cord get stuck to the end of your wand, clever. The swivel feature is nice, but not really necessary for me. I also like the attachments that come with this vacuum. I can get underneath the bed and couches easily and effectively remove dust bunnies with this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: DebLee

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I have cleaned houses for a living and used many different vacuum cleaners. Shark is by far my favorite. I even prefer them to Dyson - not to mention how much better their price. This is my third Shark Navigator and it is so far living up to my expectations. I bought it for my 82 year old father because it's so lightweight and easy to move around, even up and down the stairs. It's easy to empty and clean, and so simple and quick to use the hose and attachments. You just can't beat this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: christi moffatt

customer_reviews.title: Great suction
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has great suction. It gets lots of the fine dust my old vacuum left in the carpet. The clear plastic dust bin shows me when it needs to be emptied. After emptying the dust bin the filter is in plan sight and when it needs to be cleaned is obvious. Warm water and a littler dish soap cleans the filter simply..After a couple rinses and an overnight dry it is ready to use again. It converts from upright to portable vac easily. The vacuum is very maneuverable. Only 4 stars instead of 5 because the upholstery brush is small, the crevice wand is quite short, and the vacuum beater head is narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Hopeful Mother

customer_reviews.title: Love it and recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for months now. I love it and so does my wife. Lightweight, easy on the stairs, and great for pet owners. We were using a Bissel prior which we thought was doing a good job....not even close. Granted they weren’t quite of equal value but still. After using this vacuum I felt so dirty having seen what the Bissel couldn’t do. It looked like my steps were shampooed that’s how much it picked up. I wish it came with an extra hose piece to reach higher areas. Used in a home with carpet, hardwood, a dog, and many visitors. I will update down the road should there be any issues.
customer_reviews.author: UncleShecky

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible product. I had it for 2 months and used it a handful of times and it has already lost suction. I've adjusted the suction gauge to increase the suction but the vacuum will start making a terrible noise and begin overheating while still not creating enough suction.
customer_reviews.author: David Greene

customer_reviews.title: My favorite vacuum ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have had this vacuum for about a year and a half. I have 3 cats and a long hair dog-I vacuum almost daily. This vacuum is AWESOME. it has held up great so far. There is an indicator light when hair builds up around the floor roller, we have had to turn it upside down and use scissors to cut hair off the roller and I wish the bottom bracket came off. That is my only complaint. The canister is easy to empty and this really gets the hair up. I love the fact that you can turn to hard floor mode-MUCH easier than sweeping. It sucks up cat litter great when my cats make a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Fleming

customer_reviews.title: ... and gave it a trial run and am very happy with the performance
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and gave it a trial run and am very happy with the performance! Great suction, easy to use, the base is thinner than my last vacuum so it gets under things and into corners easier, swivels nicely and has a nice long attachment for getting under appliances and sofas and such! So far i really like it! I also like that I can take the canister off and use it as a hand held vacuum to reach cobwebs in the corner of ceilings!
customer_reviews.author: Swimmom

customer_reviews.title: Best vacuum I’ve used
customer_reviews.text: I borrowed this from a friend and loved it so much I immediately ordered my own. I did order a supplemental attachment kit that has a very long hose that allows me to move freely when doing blinds and baseboards. The kit isn’t necessary, and was not made by shark- the vacuum works amazing just as it. I just won’t some more flexibility. The suction is strong, and it works great on hardwood, tile and carpet. Great with dog hair and dust. Love it! BTW- here’s the link to the attachments I bought ZVac Compatible Attachment PET...
customer_reviews.author: KayBee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t include accessories shown in pictures!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this expecting to get all of the accessories shown in the pictures. It does not come with the appliance wand you see in picture 4 or the pet brush in picture 6!!!! When you call to ask about it they tell you to call the company and pay for them separately! Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It cloggs EVERY TIME YOU USE IT
customer_reviews.text: The design is terrible there is a 90' curve just after the handle and it cloggs regularly there designers needs to use the product prototype BEFORE introducing it to the public. This is my third Shark and I have been thrilled with the first two. So I did not hesitate when this came out to buy it promptly, now I wish I had waited for a newer model to be released be ausr this is a pain on my ass daily it cloggs and it's very difficult to in clog. Get your shit together shark I'm very disappointed in my $400 vaccine that is the shots to put itmilfly.
customer_reviews.author: Mary T.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get this vacuum until it stopped working. The suction is terrible on it. I bought it in August and thought for sure that it would last longer than this.
customer_reviews.author: SMC

customer_reviews.title: Purchased the Hoover vacuum instead and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Returned this vacuum because it produced heat from the front vent when "on" that was unbearable. Purchased the Hoover vacuum instead and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Shark Vacuum for life!
customer_reviews.text: Yesterday I vacuumed with my Dyson after my roomba ran. The roomba ran again today. (With 5 pets you can never have enough vacuums right?) After realizing the Dyson wasn't doing the job I bought this Shark. The picture speaks for itself. The amount of hair and dirt left behind by two other brands and 3 runs speaks for itself! Well worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: When you want more for your money.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is just the best out there. I have a Shark already as well as a Dyson. My dyson is in the trash already. The shark has better suction and more power than my dydon ever did. Not to mention a clip broke on my dyson so it wouldn’t stand up. We had to lean it against a wall to keep it from falling. Now with this second Shark , I can use one for outside since it works even better than my craftsman shop vac. I’m not using it for wet areas , but it works great for everything else. I hope shark makes a shop vac soon. I’ll be the first to get one !!
customer_reviews.author: yojeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Had for a few months. Constant battle to unclog the vacuum. The hand held part that comes apart for things like stair cleaning is stiff and my old shark has flexibility for things like stairs or anything needing the handheld feature, it just makes it more awkward than necessary. It works great on floors and pet hair until you realize that the design is flawed. Things get constantly stuck inside the handle where you can’t get to it. Very frustrating. On a positive note it’s very light.
customer_reviews.author: martine

customer_reviews.title: love this vacuum.  One con...
customer_reviews.text: I loved my 1st Shark so much that when I needed to replace it, I got another. The farm is hard on vacuums so to find one I love that is not horribly expensive is great. It has really good suction, easy to clean filters, and is light enough to lug around the whole house. The lift away is nice, but I usually just take the entire vacuum. One con: Between the last one I had and this one they shortened the cord. I have a big place so it's kind of a PIA. I hope they will reconsider this and go back to the longer cords in the future.
customer_reviews.author: rider237

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: It works exactly the same as the Shark Navigator Upright Vacuum for Carpet and Hard Floor with Lift-Away Handheld HEPA Filter, and Anti-Allergy Seal (NV352), Lavender. Good for small area rugs and stairs but definitely not a heavy duty vacuum. Hair still gets caught up easily and does ok with thick carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Inna

customer_reviews.title: Defective motor in vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum for a new business. I haven't had time to use it much but lately have really felt there was something wrong with it. I took it to Lansing Vacuum on Cedar St. In Lansing, Mi. They told me it had a defective motor that regulates the belt for vacuuming carpet. I would like to return this or get a credit on my account. It came to me looking brand new and I didn't use it on the carpet until recently. I still have the original box. Barbara Houston. Please reply as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Suction
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this vacuum for keep on the first floor of my home. Leaving old vacuum on the second floor. Lets face it, when your over 70 its time to make things easier for yourself if you have stairs. This machine is a great gadget. The power of the suction is A+ and the only reason I did not give it five stars is only because I wish the bottom with the roller was a bit wider and the extra attachments could be a little bigger. Other than that, I'm very pleased with this purchase. Also, I do not have a problem with it falling over as other reviewers have indicated.
customer_reviews.author: Georgie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Suction!
customer_reviews.text: Came in a box and was incredibly easy to put together. It is doing a great job on my tile floors. I loved when I switched it over to carpet--and ran over my area rug. Wow! It cleaned that rug like it has never been cleaned before. The only thing I don't like is that the vacuum tips over when I attach the long extending wand. So I have to keep a hand on it, but it is reasonably light weight, and does everything else very well. Much more powerful than its predecessor--a Bissell. If you're on a budget, this is a good bet!
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: ... lots of suction power and it does a very good job. My only reason for not giving it ...
customer_reviews.text: I find the Shark to have lots of suction power and it does a very good job. My only reason for not giving it 5 stars is the suction head could be larger which takes a little more time to complete a job.
customer_reviews.author: William C.

customer_reviews.title: dont even bother looking elsewhere, get this
customer_reviews.text: honestly i look forward to vacuuming now. usually i am the type that does tons of research before buying and will still have second thoughts about the purchase after. i do not get that with this, so thoroughly pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Emre

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed in this vacuum cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this vacuum cleaner. There are no lights on it, I don't like where the switch is located, the cord is very low, emptying the canister is not as easy as my last Shark Vacuum, and it is harder to push.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Frustratingly Poor Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I've had the vacuum for approximately 6 months and it's terrible. I live in a small, 700 sq-foot apartment and the battery won't last long enough to clean the whole apartment. Worse than that, every time I bump a wall or lift the vacuum up, dirt and crumbs fall out of the bottom and all over the floor. It's gotten to a point where it's not even worth using it because the floor ends up dirtier because of all of the crumbs that fall out of the vacuum. It's the most frustrating appliance I have ever owned. It's not worth the relatively cheap price because the quality is so poor.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Gould

customer_reviews.title: This vacuum sucks!!
customer_reviews.text: I write this review dreaming of a day when I can be alone with this vacuum! This vacuum is so efficient that it has sucked out my old nightmares! Rich people fear me because it could suck the money out of their wallet. I had a cat, and it is gone! I think the movie theater used the suction on this vacuum to create the tornado's in Sharknado! This vacuum has to be illegal because it could possibly change air pressure! I know for certain it creates weather patterns and possibly caused (at least) the moon to move slightly closer to earth! What I am trying to say is THIS VACUUM SUCKS!! PS: it works well on hardwood floors!
customer_reviews.author: marc griffin

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 - quiet, powerful and overall amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this delivered yesterday and used it immediately. Extremely easy to put together (took maybe a minute) and as soon as I turned it on I was so surprised at how quiet it is! I have one carpet in my apartment which is in our bedroom and the suction is extremely powerful on the carpet! It collected sooo much! Our apartment is mostly hardwood and vinyl and this vacuum works so so well on those floors!!! I was extremely impressed. Only downside, which I already knew before buying, is that it is a little on the heavy size but it did say that in the specs so just make sure you read them! 10/10 recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: This thing is truly wonderful. It has some exceptional attachments with it
customer_reviews.text: I have been a shark customer for a number of years. I have an older and much more expensive shark that has taken its lumps. I have replaced several hoses and other parts for the older one and while replacing the handle assembly, I discovered a hairline crack in the old Shark vac. After using language, that you would never find in any Sunday School Book, i decided to purchase this new Shark. This thing is truly wonderful. It has some exceptional attachments with it, it was almost $100.00 cheaper than my old shark, and many of the parts seem to be interchangeable. The old shark is still kickin ' very well and I still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Broken! In 6 months!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if it’s Shark or Amazon, but lately the appliances or electronics i buy are trash! I am so pissed! My first shark lasted almost 5 years! This one received in June, stopped working on October! I am super pissed! Wondering if i am past the time to charge it back through AMEX! That’s how pissed i am!
customer_reviews.author: ImSooCHI

customer_reviews.title: Run away
customer_reviews.text: The only thing you can suck up is probably hair. This vacuum sits so low to the floor it won’t even get my tile clean of debris. Have throw rugs? Forget about it. Returned. My hunt for a new vacuum continues
customer_reviews.author: elefriend02

customer_reviews.title: Very dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed in this item. It doesn't pick up lint and strings and things from my carpet and it is very hard to handle. Wish I hadn't ordered it and would return it but the return date has passed and I can't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful little vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a secondary vacuum for upstairs since the wife hated hauling our big hoover up and down the stairs. We weren't expecting much, but we're very surprised. This little thing has some power!!! It has more suction than our big one, and weigh's much less!! Only bad thing I have to say about it is the canister is pretty small and has to be emptied more often. But what can you expect with a smaller/ lighter vacuum!!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Cook

customer_reviews.title: It sucks!
customer_reviews.text: OK, it's new, and it sucks very well - that's a good thing. It falls down quite a bit when stretched via the hose. the attachments are almost worthless - like the crevice tool is 2" long which gets into nothing! I order another chinese attachment kit to handle real tools. The width of the suction bar is very small, and that can be troublesome, but, Costco eventually started selling a larger, and much more expensive unit of theirs. So, it's a choice based on price, but so far, so good...
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Gorga

customer_reviews.title: Updated:  worthless!!
customer_reviews.text: Update from my original review: march 2020. I have had this since December 2019 and it had been performing great. Today it went out and non longer has suction power. Supposedly has a 5 year warranty. I contacted shark to process this and once I got through, it just rings, I counted 36 tings before I hung up. It crapped out after 4 months! This is pathetic, reaching out to amazon for help. By far the best vacuum I've owned yet. Had it predecessor and it was great but this cleans so much better, esp on bare floor. Only dislike is that the base can be used like its predecessor if the lift away tank is off
customer_reviews.author: Chris schuckenbrock

customer_reviews.title: It truly sucks! (In the good sense!) =)
customer_reviews.text: This is the best vacuum I have had so far! Its suction power is wonderful, I am hoping it stays like thay for a long time. I had a Dyson for 6 years and it slowly lost suction and it was always hard to clean. The only problem I have with this one is that the spinning brush catches hair and it gets stuck in the bristles, a bit hard to clean. Being able to take it apart to clean stairs is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lou Brown

customer_reviews.title: Amazing vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Shark vacuum, I have in past owned nothing by Dyson vacuum cleaners but was looking for something less expensive. My mother has a Shark and told me to try it, so I decided to give this one a try. I am amazed it cleans just as well as my Dyson!! No loss of suction, we have tested this in our home...teenagers don't always empty the bin. It picks up everything on the first pass, and once you know how to use the attachments it is easier than the Dyson! The lift away feature puts it above the Dyson in my book now! Cleaning corners and blinds takes half the time! Well worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Frey

customer_reviews.title: You'll be shocked thinking your carpet is clean when it's possibly not!
customer_reviews.text: To compare I first vacuumed my area rug with my old vacuum, great! Then I used the Shark Navigator and discovered that my old vacuum did nothing. The picture is showing the amount of dirt the Navigator got after I vacuumed with my old vacuum. I was shocked! My nose and family are happier with the investment. I recommend watching the vacuum wars guy on YouTube, he knows his stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Nessa B.

customer_reviews.title: At the end of the day the suction is most important to me and I am happy with that!
customer_reviews.text: Positives-Great suction! Light weight. When the roller is engaged it feels like it is self propelled. Maneuvers easily. Negatives-Extension hose is super tight so it is hard to use on anything that is not right next to the vacuum, pulling on it at all tips the vacuum over. It does not extend very far anyway. Emptying the bin requires digging out the debris that gets caught in the one corner every-time. Haven’t had to deal with hair yet so I don’t know how it works on that. The cord is shorter than I have ever had on a vacuum but if it were any longer it would add more weight when stored to an already top heavy vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this vacuum a 10 if I could. I had an older model; took it in to have the cord replaced and bought a Kirby that was less than a year old. Within a couple weeks I wanted my old Navigator back. So, I bought this one that is a bit narrower. This one is better than the last one! I vacuum several times a week because I have fur babies. It does an excellent job on pet fur. I also use it on my floors and it works as well as sweeping. It goes under end tables well because it is a bit narrower and lays almost flat. I won’t be giving this one up!
customer_reviews.author: S. Pineda

customer_reviews.title: Loses power quickly and brush needs to be cleaned out constantly
customer_reviews.text: I had a dyson for years, and when it needed replacing I chose this one. Unfortunately this vacuum isn't nearly as good as my dyson was. I have trouble cleaning up small amounts of cat litter on hardwood floor, and I have to constantly take the roller brush out to remove hair (I live alone, so it's just me). I probably wouldn't buy this model again.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: No carpet adjustment!
customer_reviews.text: For $150, this vacuum comes up very, very short. It does not have a brushrool height adjustment. That means, for all practical purposes, it's only good on very low pile carpeting. My old vacuum could be used on it's lowest height setting on one of my rugs, and this Shark vacuum essentially chews it to pieces. And there's no way to change the height. Trying to use the vacuum without the brushroll engaged on carpet is a great arm workout, but I'm not really into it.
customer_reviews.author: E Klausmeyer

customer_reviews.title: What the what??? I actually enjoy vacuuming now?! What sorcery is this?
customer_reviews.text: I freaking LOVE this vacuum. It was a breeze to assemble - no tools needed. It is small, lightweight, and very powerful! It is so easy to maneuver and get into tight spaces. My favorite part is how simple it is to switch to handheld mode. It is literally just the press of a button. This little baby shocked me by how much dust and dog fur it picked up. Granted, my old vacuum was on its last leg, but I had no clue how much dirt and hair was left on my floor. Absolutely amazing! Great price point. I am super happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cristie

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good little vacuum for the price. It works really well and the canister is easy to clean. It took me a few uses to figure out how to take it apart for stairs and the stair handle is kind of awkward. I didn’t check sizes before I ordered and the vacuum path is narrow compared to my old vacuum and it does not have a retractable cord. But for the money it works really well. Would recommend for small areas.
customer_reviews.author: micfen

customer_reviews.title: A Very Good Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this Shark vacuum based on recommendations from several friends and neighbors, and I could not be more pleased with it. It arrived disassembled but I found it easy to put together and learn to use. Its suction power is impressive on both carpet and tile, and I really appreciate not having to deal with replacing bags on a regular basis. I do not own pets so I can't vouch for how it does on animal hair, but I can say that it is extremely efficient in dealing with the every day detritus that gets tracked into or otherwise collects inside a house.
customer_reviews.author: John D. CofieldTop Contributor: Fantasy Books

customer_reviews.title: Great Vacuum and Value
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Shark Navigator Lift Away Delux. I like this vacuum model because it's light enough for me to carry up and down the stairs, the canister lifts off of the base and makes vacuuming carpeted stairs a breeze, and it's easy to keep clean. This one comes with better attachments than the older version and the suction is just as good! They are not loud, they pick up all of the pet hair, and the don't clog!! My only two complaints about this vacuum is there is no light on the front (which is typical of most vacuums now) and the canister is a bit small. Overall, it's an amazing vacuum for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gen217

customer_reviews.title: The suction is fantastic great product
customer_reviews.text: Shark is by far the best vacuum brand. I have own three. One I gave as a gift. And the two I own now,one I have had for ten years I bought refurbished and it still runs great but the hose has duct tape and the wheel won’t stay on. I use that one in the garage. The suction is amazing. The new one is fantastic. Suction top notch. The run great,clean like crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Christne M.

customer_reviews.title: Attachment and wand are clunky
customer_reviews.text: I used to own a Bissell Pet vacuum (I forgot the exact name of the product) and I preferred that one to this Shark mainly because it is impossible to really get under things with this wand and the attachments b/c they are so thick and hard plastic (not flexible). I have a hard time reaching tight spots when I didn't have that problem with the Bissell. I do like the fact that the vacuum head swivels for ease of maneuverability and it does have good suction, but overall, I am disappointed with the purchase as I mainly bought it to use the canister and the attachments. I have mostly wood floors in my house. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy L.

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum strong suction you wont regret buying it
customer_reviews.text: Pros: First time I used it I couldnt believe how much suction comes from it I used my old vacuum first then when I put this one together and tried it out just on the same rug I got a 1/4 of the vacuum full ,it was like I never vacuumed with old vacuum it was amazing.very easy to use for the lift away and does an amazing job Cons: I can see flaws in it that the clips that take off the bucket to empty it can get worn out or stop working and break with in time right away and the switch from brush to floor I can see breaking or shorting out.
customer_reviews.author: Smith's

customer_reviews.title: I really like this vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I vacuumed with my old vaccine that I thought still worked rather well until I followed it up immediately with this vacuum. This vacuum picked up nearly double what my other vacuum picked up AFTER the carpet had already been vacuumed. I wish that all the accessories could be attached to the vacuum, though. There are a few other minor annoyances but overall this is a very good vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: 3 Dogs, Easy to Use & Great Size.
customer_reviews.text: Bought May 5 and it’s Sept 2. I have 3 dogs and I just had to clean the foam filter for the first time today. And yes my house gets vacuumed at least 1 time a week. Right after I bought it, my mother who’s always been a Dyson and Rainbow owner, went and got this exact vacuum. That says a lot! This vacuum moves around better than any other I’ve owned and I’m happy I didn’t buy a bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: Swt_Tea

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, not the original Sharks
customer_reviews.text: This product did not have the power of precious Shark Navigators. It lost suction almost immediately, lost power drive function working a month, rollers impossible to clean, and you can no longer remove a few screws on vac head to check belts or clean the roller. Screws have an entirely different pattern not universal flat head or Phillips. Don’t buy absolute junk! Bless Amazon for allowing me to return after 34 days of moderate use on hard wood and oriental carpets! No more Shark Navigators.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thatcher

customer_reviews.title: Cord management
customer_reviews.text: To all the people that complained about tripping on the cord because it comes out the bottom OR the people who had tangled up messes of cord: Please see my pictures on how to manage the cord. I vacuumed the stars half with the base and half with just the canister. The canister is a bit wobbly on the carpet, but it never actually fell over. Great suction and the filter works great. Also tried it on tile with sand. You just don't turn on the brush and it sucked it all right up.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: what a mess
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum is good for suction and the rotating handle is good. Product on the heavy side. BUT, the mess it creates when trying to empty the canister is intolerable! And the canister itself is extremely small, constantly need to empty. Now about emptying this thing - no matter where or how you choose to empty it, it will leave a mess. If you have a good working vacuum with a bag attachment - keep it. This bagless vacuum leaves almost as much of a mess (almost) as before cleaning! Disgusted!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: This vacuum is way too heavy.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is very heavy! I don't like it at all. I would have returned it after the first use, but it is too heavy for me to get it to the car much less get it into the car. I bought it two months ago and used it for the second time today. What a chore! Since It has been sixty days and I can't get it into the car to return it anyway, I guess it will just be taking up space in the closet.
customer_reviews.author: Trudi Mason

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Warranty !! Great Vacuum as long as its Working.
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed by the vacuum, Great suction power, The only thing I didn't like was the width of the brush head, thought it could be a little 'wider. Vacuum worked great for 10 uses, then brush wouldn't spin, No Power. So I called customer support, They said NO ELECTRICAL COMPONENTS, including MOTORS or even my on/off switch were covered under warranty. So DON'T' be fooled by the 5 YEAR 'Limited Warranty. It basicly covers the wheels and hoses. So if your vacuum fails after 10 uses like mine did, it will cost you another $118 to replace a faulty electrical switch on the brush head. Buyer Beware !!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum for dog hair - better than oreck
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum for dog hair. We have an oreck too, but wanted one we can dump out the canister after each use so we weren’t constantly replacing bags. I love my oreck, but I can honestly say this one is even more powerful in regards to suction power and maneuverability. The only downside is the head/mouth is smaller, so you have to take more passes, but that doesn’t bother me. Our dog is getting older and gets on one of our living room chairs to sleep at night so we have to clean it regularly with the upholstery attachment which also works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: Great value, effective & efficient machine
customer_reviews.text: Have used this for about 2 months now. I'm pleasantly surprised at how well it works on carpet AND hard floor. Easy to switch the brush on for carpet. Had a more expensive vacuum (starts w 'H') that was advertised as working well on hard & soft surfaces...The Shark is lighter, seems more powerful, & does a better job in all situations I've put it through. Great pickup of dust, fur, & long hair.
customer_reviews.author: MomOfOne

customer_reviews.title: It is very lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have stairs or pets so really can't answer those questions. The brush attachment doesn't stay where it's supposed to and it's made cheaper than I thought it would be. I bought it because I moved and thought it would be nice to have a new vacuum. After using it, I decided to use my old vacuum. I'm hoping it will grow on me.
customer_reviews.author: sadiemae

customer_reviews.title: Shark Upright Is Very Functional
customer_reviews.text: This is a vacuum cleaner that almost pulls the pad through the carpet. Well, not really, but it pulls up more dirt and other things from the carpet than anything else we have used. It is also light weight and a little smaller than most vacuums, so it will go where other can't. The canister lifts off for cleaning of furniture and stairs. The price is great also.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth F. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum I've had for 10 years broke a couple weeks ago, so I researched and decided to go with this one. I've used several vacuums including expensive brands and this is by far my favorite. It handles really well and is easy to maneuver. It's lightweight and comes apart easily to convert into a handheld vacuum. It has useful attachments, including one for under appliances. Most importantly, it works great! My floors look fantastic. It really makes vacuuming a pleasure. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Frances T.

customer_reviews.title: So great that I have to buy another one!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to put together!! We bought it because we have a 2story home and it would just be easier to have one on each floor... well now I am buying another one because after 1 round in the living room there was SOOO much dirt and dog hair that our other vacuum missed. It grossed me out and I then had to do our whole house. The vacuum is very light and easy to maneuver! Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Kortnee Brooks

customer_reviews.title: THIS REALLY SUCKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Shark! I've been through 3 vacuum cleaners in the last couple years. Two have gone to the dump. The third is crap, but I can use it in the basement. We have 2 large dogs who track in a ton of leaf litter and outside "stuff" into the house, so I need something that really sucks it all up. This does. The Shark is lightweight enough for arthritic shoulders. And it's self-propelled so that helps a ton. The dust cup is easy to empty. One of the accessories was missing, but I doubt I'd ever use it. So far so good, and I love my Shark!
customer_reviews.author: DoodleMom

customer_reviews.title: Cumbersome vacuum, not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Looked good on photos, but this thing is hard to navigate around house, keeps on locking in upright position, had to constantly assemble/disassemble to get under beds and couches. I guess you get what you pay for, right? Sending this back, will go with more expensive Dyson.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but great suction
customer_reviews.text: Nice vacuum for the $115 price I paid. But you get what you pay for, and it has a really cheap feel to it. But have to admit, the suction power is pretty amazing. One of the latches on the side that holds the main container has already broken off after 4 weeks of regular use. But it still fictions properly regardless of that. I don't expect it to last over 1 year, but I have a dog and messy kids so it'll probably be smelling by that time anyway and we'll need to replace.
customer_reviews.author: katrina4782

customer_reviews.title: Just get it! You won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 10 year old shark that was being held together by duct tape. It still worked perfectly but it was time for a new one. This new one is sooo much better! The suction pretty much propels the vacuum forward and drags you along with it. It’s lighter and the lift away makes it so easy to do steps. I bought the pet hair brush also and wow! I love this vacuum. The best on the market hands down!!
customer_reviews.author: Maiysha Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Can't use on thicker carpet.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work on the main carpet of my house because it's apparently too thick. It will do my other carpet just fine. In fact, it takes more effort to hold back the vacuum than it does to push it. There is a suction switch you can adjust so it doesn't suck as much to allow for easier push but it does nothing for my carpet. It's unusable in my living room. I do like using the vacuum for my laminate floors. Also, the cord is very short.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Deep clean machine with plenty of suction.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction - lightweight design. Plenty of suction. Moves and grooves around corners and furniture with ease. Roller brush deep cleans rugs and carpets effectively. Easy to assemble and clean after use. Too soon to rate longevity and durability. One note - if the power cord were a couple feet longer and raised a tad higher where it connects to the unit it garners a 5 star . As it is, it does pose a tripping hazard. Would still purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: littlewolf

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed; very quiet & maneuverable
customer_reviews.text: One disclaimer: we are upgrading from a 20+ year old cleaner. Overall, after a couple of weeks, we are really pleased with this vacuum. The biggest surprise is how quiet it is (vs our 20-year-old beast.) Also, it is very lightweight and maneuverable. We have a dog that loves to shed and the cleaner went to town on the fur. That was a big plus. Also, the detachable hose works well for furniture and stairs. We have zero complaints. Great purchase. I just hope that it being lightweight and quiet doesn't mean it will wear out soon. But, for the price, if we get five years out of it, that'd be great. ProTip: if your cleaner is >20 yrs: upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: A vacuum that works!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter owns a Shark. After two Electrolux vacuums dying on me in five years and a raving review of her Shark from her, I decided to try the Shark! So glad I did, the best vacuum ever!!!! It does everything they claim and more. I cannot complain about one thing when it comes to this vacuum. I have both hard wood floors as well as a area rug in my living room area and it works well on both. If you need a vacuum, this is the one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second vacuum of this model
customer_reviews.text: Both of the vaccums i have bought, shark navigator, 360 and 350 have both been missing the holder for the attachments. I can buy the part separately but it shows it with it. This one was in a sealed box. I checked to see if it was in the box, it was not. So there is no place to put the attachments like on other sharks i have purchased. I have 4 of these total, i have a bnb is why i have so many. They last and work so well.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Best vacuum I have ever owned. I would vacuum with a cheaper brand every day and not get much. As soon as I vacuumed with this it made it seem like I had never vacuumed!!! It made my carpet feel new again. I will never use a different brand again. Definitely worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Tmill

customer_reviews.title: Not living up to other shark vacuums. Not good for whole house cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: I usually love the shark products but this one is a fail. I think it would be perfect for a small apartment or for womeone with limited space but it is too small in the area that has suction and I'm having to go over the same area three or four times in order to get the same cleaning power as our last vacumn. This one is going to be donated to a college student. (On the plus side-it would be perfect for dorms! Just not for whole house cleaning).
customer_reviews.author: Bill C.

customer_reviews.title: VERY HARD to push on carpet
customer_reviews.text: I read a review about this vacuum being hard to push on carpet, but assumed the person didn't know how to use the adjustment control since other reviews were so good. NOPE! Even on the easiest setting, this vacuum is incredibly hard to push. Would give me an aching back every time I vacuumed if I chose to keep it, which I am not. Also, it doesn't suck up from the sides very well on the hard floors. Would NOT recommend this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  What a vacuum!!
customer_reviews.text: compact, lightweight and super charged vacuum power! I thought that maybe the narrow width would be an issue but no, it actually helps in maneuvering the vacuum around. Very powerful for its size and extremely easy to use and empty the dirt canister. The power cord is a good length but the accessory hose is a bit short but because this is so light I can just pick up the whole thing when needed. Only thing missing maybe is a headlight but other than that this is a great vacuum. I do really like it and how quiet it is. Much quieter than my other upright and my canister vac. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: DeepDishorThin

customer_reviews.title: vacuum does not have a bag or beater bar.
customer_reviews.text: I dont like this vacuum. I guess I just missed the return deadline. it is messy to dump holding tank. The vacuum blows air out the top part which blows papers, dust out into room you are vacuuming. The attachment holder is not a good fit, attachments fall off vacuum when slightly bumped. The electric cord is the shortest ever. It doesn't reach as far as any other vacuum I've ever had, which makes it time customizing to change outlets after doing just one small room. I wanted to return but just missed the return cut off deadline. Darn. Would never buy or recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Dreamcatcher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hard floors!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t normally leave reviews but for anyone looking for a vacuum for hard floors this does not disappoint! It has saved me so much time. I used to have to sweep, then vacuum because my old vacuum wouldn’t pick up everything. I have cut my cleaning time in half with this vacuum. I can clean my whole house with it. We live on a lake surrounded by fields and woods. With three kids and two dogs there is a lot of stuff tracked in the house daily, so cleanup is a big job. I looked at a ton of different vacuums and so happy I ordered this one!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie C.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, powerful and cleverly built
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice vacuum cleaner. I love the ability to take apart mostly when cleaning out the car. Also it's nice not to have a bag to contend. It is so easy to release the snaps on the side and empty the container. The motor is very powerful and it collects an amazing amount of dust, carpet fiber, hair etc. The swivel head makes it very easy to navigate over flooring. The only down size is the relatively small "head"....I wish it were wider.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Decker

customer_reviews.title: Does not include a photoed attachment
customer_reviews.text: The most irritating thing is that I bought this vaccum a few months back at a home depot and it included a mini brush roll attachment for the handle which it shows in the images for this item BUT IS NOT ACTUALLY INCLUDED. It was literally a huge reason why I bought this item for someone else. That little roller brush attachment is PERFECT for stairs, couches and anything that requires small space adaption.. and it's not part of this model or version. But its still in the images. How disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

product_meta.title: Shark Navigator Lift-Away Deluxe NV360 Upright Vacuum, Blue
product_meta.description:
Shark Navigator Professional Upright Vacuum for Carpet and Hard Floor with Lift Away Hand Vacuum and Anti-Allergy Seal (NV360), Blue.

BRAND STORY
By Shark
feature_bullets: Lift away press a button to lift the canister away and easily clean hard to reach areas
Anti-allergen complete seal technology, a HEPA filter traps 999 percent of dust and allergens inside the vacuum. The full unit weighs only 12.5 pounds, the canister alone is 7.5 pounds
Swivel steering excellent control for maneuvering around furniture dust cup capacity: 12 dry quarts
Large capacity, easy to empty dust cup extended cleaning without interruption
What's Included: (1) Upholstery tool, (1) 5.5 inch crevice tool

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars7,217 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
